contributing

Source: vignettes/contributing.Rmd
contributing.Rmd

There are two ways to contribute album-art inspried color palettes to ggroove. If you’re comfortable with git + GitHub, you can simply fork and create a branch of the repo, and submit your changes as a pull request.

The color palettes are stored rather inelegantly in data-raw/DATASET.R

Basically, to add a new palette just follow the template of the other palettes and use dplyr::bind_rows to add your new palette onto the database. See example here

If doesn’t sound like your jam, you can submit an issue, and select the template for requesting a color palette to be added. You can then manually add your palette into the table template created for you there, submit your issue, and someone will get back to you when they can.

Developed by Dan Ovando.

Site built with pkgdown 1.6.1.
